subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Espero que tú _____ con tu familia hoy. (hablar)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: After 'espero que' (I hope that), we use the present subjunctive. For 'hablar' with 'tú', the subjunctive form is 'hables'.
hints: Remember: -AR verbs in subjunctive use -e endings instead of -a.

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Es importante que ella _____ para el examen. (estudiar)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'Es importante que' is an impersonal expression requiring subjunctive. Regular -AR verbs change the 'a' to 'e'.
hints: Impersonal expressions like 'es importante que' always trigger the subjunctive.

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Es bueno que ellos _____ cerca de la escuela. (vivir)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'Es bueno que' is an impersonal expression requiring subjunctive. -IR verbs in subjunctive end in -a.
hints: Think about what ending -IR verbs take in subjunctive.

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: No creo que él _____ en eso. (pensar)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'No creo que' expresses doubt and requires subjunctive. 'Pensar' changes e→ie in stressed syllables, but keeps the e in nosotros/vosotros.
hints: Stem-changing verbs keep their stem change in subjunctive!

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Dudo que ella _____ venir a la fiesta. (querer)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'Dudo que' (I doubt that) expresses uncertainty. 'Querer' is e→ie stem-changing, so it becomes 'quiera'.
hints: When you doubt something, subjunctive expresses that uncertainty.

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Ojalá que yo _____ ir al concierto. (poder)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'Ojalá (que)' expresses hope and always requires subjunctive. 'Poder' changes o→ue: pueda.
hints: 'Ojalá' always uses subjunctive—it comes from Arabic meaning 'may Allah grant'!

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: No pienso que tú _____ las llaves aquí. (encontrar)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'No pienso que' expresses negative opinion/doubt. 'Encontrar' is o→ue: encuentres.
hints: Negative opinions trigger subjunctive mood.

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Recomiendo que ustedes _____ ocho horas. (dormir)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'Dormir' is a special o→ue/u verb. In present subjunctive, it changes o→ue in most forms: duerman.
hints: This verb has a boot-shaped stem change pattern!

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Sugiero que tú _____ ayuda cuando la necesites. (pedir)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'Pedir' changes e→i throughout the subjunctive (unlike some stem-changing verbs). With 'sugiero que': pidas.
hints: Some -IR verbs change e→i in ALL subjunctive forms!

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Es raro que él _____ tan callado hoy. (ser)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'Ser' is completely irregular in subjunctive. The forms are: sea, seas, sea, seamos, seáis, sean.
hints: 'Ser' has a completely irregular subjunctive stem!

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: No creo que ellos _____ en casa ahora. (estar)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'Estar' has accent marks in subjunctive: esté, estés, esté, estemos, estéis, estén.
hints: Remember the accent marks on this irregular verb!

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Espero que tú _____ al médico pronto. (ir)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'Ir' is highly irregular: vaya, vayas, vaya, vayamos, vayáis, vayan.
hints: This verb of motion has a completely different stem in subjunctive!

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Dudo que ella _____ la verdad. (saber)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'Saber' has irregular stem 'sep-': sepa, sepas, sepa, sepamos, sepáis, sepan.
hints: Think of the -yo form in present: sé → sep- in subjunctive.

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Es necesario que yo le _____ las gracias. (dar)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'Dar' is irregular and takes accent marks: dé, des, dé, demos, deis, den. The accent on 'dé' distinguishes it from the preposition 'de'.
hints: Watch out for the accent mark on the yo and él forms!

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Me sorprende que tú no _____ el problema. (ver)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'Ver' keeps the 'e' and adds subjunctive endings: vea, veas, vea, veamos, veáis, vean.
hints: This verb is less irregular than you might think—just add the endings!

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Quiero que ustedes _____ la tarea ahora. (hacer)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'Hacer' uses stem 'hag-': haga, hagas, haga, hagamos, hagáis, hagan.
hints: Take the yo form (hago) and replace -o with subjunctive endings.

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Es importante que ellos _____ paciencia. (tener)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'Tener' uses stem 'teng-' (from yo form 'tengo'): tenga, tengas, tenga, tengamos, tengáis, tengan.
hints: Think of the yo form: tengo → teng- + subjunctive endings.

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Ojalá que él _____ a la reunión mañana. (venir)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'Venir' is irregular with stem 'veng-': venga, vengas, venga, vengamos, vengáis, vengan.
hints: Based on yo form: vengo → veng- + endings.

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: No es verdad que yo _____ mentiras. (decir)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'Decir' has stem 'dig-': diga, digas, diga, digamos, digáis, digan.
hints: From yo form: digo → dig- + subjunctive endings.

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Te llamaré en cuanto yo _____ los resultados. (saber)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'En cuanto' (as soon as) requires subjunctive when referring to future actions.
hints: Conjunctions about pending future actions trigger subjunctive.

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Trabaja duro para que tú _____ tener éxito. (poder)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'Para que' (so that, in order that) always requires subjunctive, expressing purpose.
hints: Purpose clauses with 'para que' always use subjunctive!

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Aunque _____ cansado, voy a ayudarte. (estar, yo)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'Aunque' can use subjunctive when there's uncertainty or to emphasize regardless of circumstances.
hints: 'Aunque' with subjunctive emphasizes 'no matter if' or hypothetical situations.

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Mi madre quería que yo _____ español en casa. (hablar)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: Past trigger 'quería que' requires imperfect subjunctive. Two forms exist: hablara (more common) or hablase.
hints: When the main verb is in the past, use imperfect subjunctive!

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Si yo _____ rico, viajaría por el mundo. (ser)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'Si' clauses expressing hypothetical (contrary-to-fact) situations use imperfect subjunctive. 'Ser': fuera/fuese.
hints: Hypothetical 'if' clauses use imperfect subjunctive + conditional.

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Ojalá que yo _____ más tiempo para estudiar. (tener)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: 'Ojalá' + imperfect subjunctive expresses a wish about the present that's unlikely/impossible.
hints: 'Ojalá' + imperfect subjunctive = wishful thinking about now.

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Si tú _____ venir, sería fantástico. (poder)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: Hypothetical condition with 'si' + imperfect subjunctive. 'Poder': pudiera/pudiese.
hints: This is a polite way to invite someone: 'if you could come...'

subjunctive_exercises.prompt: Ella dudaba que nosotros _____ la respuesta. (saber)
subjunctive_exercises.explanation: Past doubt 'dudaba que' triggers imperfect subjunctive. 'Saber': supiera/supiese.
hints: Match the tense: past doubt triggers imperfect subjunctive.
